thread.title: UMass vs. Kent State: Scouting the Golden Flashes by the numbers
thread.title_full: UMass vs. Kent State: Scouting the Golden Flashes by the numbers

author: Daniel Malone | Special to MassLive
title: UMass vs. Kent State: Scouting the Golden Flashes by the numbers
text:
Here's a look at some numbers and statistics concerning Kent State to consider as the University of Massachusetts football team prepares for Saturday's homecoming game against the Golden Flashes. 40-17: The score of last year's UMass-Kent State game 
The Minutemen took out a lot of their 2014 frustrations on the Flashes last October. 296.3: Yards allowed per game by Kent State's defense 
That sub-300 mark is tops in the Mid-American Conference. Of course, holding Delaware State to -33 total yards a few weeks ago definitely helps in that category. 37: Career passing attempts for George Bollas 
The redshirt freshman could be making his first start under center for the Flashes this week. He came on in relief of Colin Reardon last week and completed 10 of 21 attempts for 77 yards and an interception last week. 
[ LISTEN: UMass Podcast: Kent State preview with the Record-Courier's Allen Moff ] 3,002: Career rushing yards for Trayion Durham 
The bruising 250-pound senior eclipsed the impressive career mark last week against Toledo. He also has 26 career touchdowns. 3.5: Durham's yards per carry this season 
The 3,000-yard milestone is nice, but so far 2015 has been Durham's most inconsistent of his career. He's cracked the 100-yard mark just once this season. 5: Interceptions for Demetrius Monday 
The sophomore corner leads the MAC in picks and is tied for third in the nation. They come in bunches, too, with Monday intercepting more than one pass twice already this season. 
Follow MassLive.com UMass beat writer @Daniel_Malone on Twitter or reach him via email .
